author: Francisco Fernández
title: Taylor Swift, el apoyo para Gypsy Rose Blanchard durante su estancia en la cárcel
text:
Gypsy Rose Blanchard ha dejado la cárcel durante las primeras horas de este viernes 29 de diciembre luego de pasar los últimos siete años cumpliendo una condena por la muerte de su madre, Dee Dee Blanchard, el 14 de junio del 2015.
Gypsy junto con su entonces novio Nicholas Godejohn mataron a Dee Dee de 48 años, quien hacía creer a su hija que sufría enfermedades crónicas y que estaba postrada en una silla de ruedas para recibir la caridad de las personas de la comunidad que conocían su caso.
En un principio se condenó a Gypsy a una pena de 10 años ya que el juez consideró que la joven era víctima de maltrato psicológico y físico por parte de su madre y que no era parte de un plan junto con Dee Dee para engañar a las numerosas organizaciones benéficas que hicieron donaciones para su familia; sin embargo, Godejohn no corrió con la misma suerte y fue sentenciado a cadena perpetua.
Irónicamente Gypsy encontró en la cárcel la libertad que nunca le permitió su madre y a diferencia de muchas personas ganó peso durante su estancia, pero no fue sencillo pasar este periodo tras las rejas ya que también buscó apoyo emocional y lo encontró en las canciones de Taylor Swift.
Incluso desde antes de que cometiera el crimen con el que se liberó de la sombra de su progenitora, Gypsy ya encontraba en los temas de Taylor un alivio para los maltratos y abusos sufridos por parte de su madre quien incluso le ocultó su verdadera edad a su hija para evitar que pudiera tomar decisiones una vez cumplida la mayoría de edad.
La mujer que comenzó a disfrutar de su verdadera libertad este viernes, le dijo al medio TMZ lo mucho que se ayudó con la música de Taylor Swift para superar los momentos difíciles e incluso gastaba el dinero que le enviaba su padre a prisión para comprar todos los álbumes de la cantante, incluidas las reediciones.
Una vez liberada, Gypsy Rose fue recibida por su esposo Ken, a quien conoció durante su estancia en prisión y contrajo nupcias en el centro penitenciario de Chillicothe en Ohio.
Una de las primeras cosas que hará Gypsy como una mujer libre será acudir este domingo al Arrowhead Stadium, casa de los Kansas City Chiefs en donde espera poder encontrarse con Taylor Swift.

author: Beatrice Sayers
title: From Hitler Youth to Judaism: Yitzchak von Schweitzer tells his story at Limmud - Jewish News
text:
A Limmud slogan on banners and screens around the festival in Birmingham reads ‘taking you one step further on your Jewish journey’. The journey had been pretty long already for one participant, a former Hitler Youth member and Waffen-SS officer who with his wife spoke about their nearly 40 years as Orthodox Jews.
Yitzchak von Schweitzer, a lively 97, spoke with confidence and candour at the session on Tuesday, chaired probingly and with humour by Clive Lawton, one of the founders of Limmud. A film about his life was screened, telling how he was christened Helmut into an aristocratic family that could trace its ancestry to 1751.
Asked by Clive what as a 16-year-old he would have thought about the Jews, Yitzchak replied: “‘They’re being persecuted and I really don’t want to talk about it.’ That was the typical German attitude. The Germans weren’t all war criminals but they knew when to keep their mouths shut.” Get The Jewish News Daily Edition by email and never miss our top stories Free Sign Up
An early memory, from 1935 when he was nine or 10, was a doll his younger sister Rosie had during the time the family moved from his native Austria to Germany. “Unusually for Europe at that time, her doll was a dark coffee colour,” he said. On the train journey, her father and stepmother tried to persuade Rosie to accept an expensive new doll with blond hair and blue eyes but she declined. “Then suddenly Dad grabbed the black doll and put it away,” Yitzchak recalled. “Rosie was crying bitterly. I was dumbfounded. Rosie would never touch the new doll. To the end of her life she would still recall her horror of her experience.”
A girl wearing a yellow star started staring at me and I stared back at her
Yitzchak joined the Deutsches Jungvolk, the section of Hitler Youth for boys aged 10-13. His father was appointed a captain in the Wehrmacht and was called up when war was declared in 1939. Among Yitzchak’s wartime memories is a visit to one of the fabric factories owned by his uncle, where he saw Jews, who had been put to work there, wearing yellow stars. “A girl started staring at me,” he recalled, “and I stared back at her.”
When, in 1944, recruiters arrived in his village looking for volunteers, Yitzchak enlisted. He was posted in April 1945 to a position a few miles north-east of Berlin to defend against the Russians. Under heavy artillery fire, he and his unit were left without support, or food. He initiated an organised retreat – to find their commander at the back.
Having surrendered, he was taken as a POW to England, where he worked as part of a bomb disposal unit in London. A memory from this time is of Israel’s Declaration of Independence on 14 May 1948, which he heard about during a party that evening to celebrate his 22nd birthday. “For me it was like a hit in the heart,” he recalled. “How could it be possible that a miracle like that could happen, to me of all people? It must be that I’ve got to do something about it.”
He applied to study at the LSE, as an Austrian rather than as a German, and met an Englishwoman, Anne. In 1975, now married with two children, they moved to South Africa to follow new business opportunities.
Having made a rather daring attempt to become Jewish we were accepted, rather than suspected
From the beginning of their stay in South Africa both he and his wife were employed by Jewish companies, and surrounded by Jewish friends, one of whom introduced them to Angela, wife of Rabbi Barry Marcus, of Waverley Hebrew Congregation in Johannesburg. “We felt at home, and began to consider conversion to Judaism,” Yitzchak said. “We would have to prove our eligibility by conduct and learning.” The South African community was not much concerned about his German past and accepted the couple as a family, he said. “It was up to us to fit in. There were a lot of conditions for us, most of which would be life-changing.”
Yitzchak’s book was published in June 2023 Recalling his first Shabbat evening service, he said: “We had been invited in. We had to do our best to deserve it. We had to take our chance with open arms. So we did. Having made a rather daring attempt to become Jewish we were accepted, rather than suspected.”
After three years of study, all four members of the family underwent conversion, and he and his wife were given their Jewish names. The couple, married for 15 years already, had a Jewish wedding ceremony, a “really special experience”, in December 1984.
Last year, Yitzchak celebrated his second barmitzvah, aged 96, surrounded by family and community. “I could look back at nearly 40 years of being Jewish, feeling very much like I belonged.”
Rivka told the audience about a recent, momentous discovery. Brought up in the East End, in the rag trade, she said she had never felt she fitted in. “I was searching for something.” Recently she had done a DNA test through the 23andMe ancestry website and had found she was 51 percent Ashkenazi. As a child, she had always felt unwanted by her mother’s husband and late in life had found a reason: “Maybe he knew the truth, that he wasn’t my father,” she told the Limmud audience. The DNA test also led to the discovery that her natural father was a Cohen. “So now I feel I really do belong.”
Yitzchak has recorded his story for the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum and in June published a book, From German War to Jewish Peace : My life journey from the Waffen-SS to Judaism
Support your Jewish community. Support your Jewish News Thank you for helping to make Jewish News the leading source of news and opinion for the UK Jewish community. Today we're asking for your invaluable help to continue putting our community first in everything we do.
For as little as £5 a month you can help sustain the vital work we do in celebrating and standing up for Jewish life in Britain.
Read more Jewish News holds our community together and keeps us connected. Like a synagogue, it’s where people turn to feel part of something bigger. It also proudly shows the rest of Britain the vibrancy and rich culture of modern Jewish life.
You can make a quick and easy one-off or monthly contribution of £5, £10, £20 or any other sum you’re comfortable with.
100% of your donation will help us continue celebrating our community, in all its dynamic diversity...
Engaging
Being a community platform means so much more than producing a newspaper and website. One of our proudest roles is media partnering with our invaluable charities to amplify the outstanding work they do to help us all.
Celebrating
There’s no shortage of oys in the world but Jewish News takes every opportunity to celebrate the joys too, through projects like Night of Heroes, 40 Under 40 and other compelling countdowns that make the community kvell with pride.
Pioneering
In the first collaboration between media outlets from different faiths, Jewish News worked with British Muslim TV and Church Times to produce a list of young activists leading the way on interfaith understanding.
Campaigning
Royal Mail issued a stamp honouring Holocaust hero Sir Nicholas Winton after a Jewish News campaign attracted more than 100,000 backers. Jewish Newsalso produces special editions of the paper highlighting pressing issues including mental health and Holocaust remembrance.
Easy access
In an age when news is readily accessible, Jewish News provides high-quality content free online and offline, removing any financial barriers to connecting people.
Voice of our community to wider society
The Jewish News team regularly appears on TV, radio and on the pages of the national press to comment on stories about the Jewish community. Easy access to the paper on the streets of London also means Jewish News provides an invaluable window into the community for the country at large.
We hope you agree all this is worth preserving.

author: @jmazzara
title: Nueva Zelanda acusó a Bev Priestman, DT de Canadá, por espionaje - Bolavip Argentina
text:
Juegos Olímpicos Despiden a una DT por espionaje con drones en plenos Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024 Bev Priestman fue acusada de espiar el entrenamiento de Nueva Zelanda, y no dirigió en el debut de Canadá por los Juegos Olímpicos.
Ganó 28 medallas en los Juegos Olímpicos, estuvo preso y ahora, Michael Phelps es empresario Los 3 candidatos de Meta AI para ganar los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024 Por Julián Mazzara
Actualizado el 25/07/2024 - 22:44hs ART
whatsapp
Actualizado el 25/07/2024 - 22:44hs ART
© IMAGO / Sven Simon Despidieron a Bev Priestman, DT de Canadá, tras ser denunciada por espionaje a Nueva Zelanda Por Julián Mazzara
Así como se produjo el bochorno en el debut de la Selección Argentina , que finalmente fue derrotada a manos de Marruecos en los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024 , las insólitas historias no dejan de hacerse presente en la capital francesa.
En el estreno de la fase de grupos del fútbol femenino, Canadá perdió 2-1 ante Nueva Zelanda , pero la noticia que sacudió al mundo entero estuvo relacionada con Bev Priestman , la entrenadora inglesa de The Canucks, quien fue despedida en plena competencia luego de una denuncia que las oceánicas hicieron ante el Comité Olímpico Internacional .
Las All Whites aseguraron que las canadienses enviaron espías y filmaron el entrenamiento, por lo que desde el COI hicieron las averiguaciones pertinentes y decidieron sacar de la competencia a la entrenadora asistente Jasmine Mander y el analista de Canada Soccer, Joseph Lombardi . A raíz de ello, Priestman no dirigió el cotejo que se llevó a cabo en Saint-Étienne, y emitió un comunicado solicitando sus disculpas.
“Soy la máximo responsable de la conducta en nuestro programa. Por consiguiente, para enfatizar el compromiso de nuestro equipo con la integridad, he decidido retirarme voluntariamente de entrenar el partido del jueves” , comenzó la entrenadora de 38 años. Y añadió: “En un espíritu de responsabilidad, hago esto teniendo en mente los intereses de ambos equipos y para asegurar que todos sientan que se respeta el espíritu deportivo de este juego” .
Además de sentirse apenada por la situación, exclamó que “en nombre de todo nuestro equipo, ante todo quiero pedir disculpas a los jugadores y al personal de New Zealand Football y a los jugadores del equipo de Canadá. Esto no representa los valores que defiende nuestro equipo” . Según pudo averiguar el COI , los días 19 y el 22 de julio en Saint-Étienne se reportaron dos eventos distintos con los drones.
Cabe destacar que desde el organismo encargado de promover el olimpismo en el mundo y coordinar las actividades del Movimiento Olímpico lograron develar que Lombardi era uno de las personas involucradas, ya que las autoridades francesas lo detuvieron tras avistar que un dron sobrevolaba por el entrenamiento neozelandés. En consecuencia, le pidieron disculpas al Comité Olímpico de Nueva Zelanda y también a la Federación de Futbol de Nueva Zelanda .
Bev Priestman no dirigirá en el debut de Canadá en los Juegos Olímpicos. (IMAGO / ZUMA Press Wire)
El fixture de la Selección de Canadá en el fútbol femenino de los Juegos Olímpicos París 2024 25 de julio – Canadá vs. Nueva Zelanda – Saint-Étienne 28 de julio – Francia vs. Canadá – Saint-Étienne 31 de julio – Colombia vs. Canadá – Niza

Grupos y equipos participantes de los Juegos Olímpicos París 2024 Grupo A: Canadá, Francia, Colombia y Nueva Zelanda Grupo B: Alemania, Estados Unidos, Australia y Zambia Grupo C: España, Brasil, Japón y Nigeria Julián Mazzara
Redactor de Bolavip Argentina desde 2021, cubriendo la actualidad del fútbol argentino y deportes en general. Periodista Deportivo recibido en 2018 de la Escuela Superior de Periodismo Deportivo del Circulo de Periodistas Deportivos, José R. López Pájaro, y vinculado a los medios de comunicación desde 2013. Trabajó previamente en medios gráficos y radiales como FWTV, Eco Medios y Radio Late.

author: Brandy Gaskins
title: Climate Vault and its Supporters Reduce Climate Damages by More than $250 Million - Environmental News Today - EIN Presswire
text: Climate Vault, an award-winning nonprofit, announced today that it has reduced the damages from climate change by more than $250 million in collaboration with its supporters. Climate Vault’s mission is to significantly reduce carbon dioxide emissions that are causing climate change, while supporting innovation in carbon dioxide removal (CDR) technologies designed to eliminate historical emissions. “Climate Vault is providing organizations and individuals a way to credibly fight climate change,” said Michael Greenstone, Co-Founder of Climate Vault and the Milton Friedman Distinguished Service Professor of Economics at the University of Chicago. “In this period of reckoning over traditional voluntary carbon offsets failing to deliver the promised carbon reductions, more and more organizations are turning to Climate Vault precisely because we provide a trusted way for them to reduce their carbon footprint. The urgency of the climate challenge means that good intentions are not enough, and that is what motivates Climate Vault every day to go out and lock away more tons of carbon dioxide.” Since the organization’s public launch in May 2021, it has acquired and “vaulted” carbon dioxide emissions allowances from government-regulated compliance markets. The result is that polluters in those markets, like utilities and power plants, are prevented from using them to emit. Climate Vault’s current inventory of locked away allowances exceeds 1.1 million metric tons of carbon dioxide. These vaulted allowances have reduced the expected damages from climate change by more than $250 million. This reduction in damages means people around the planet can lead longer and healthier lives, storms will be less dangerous, crop yield will be greater, and there will be fewer days when people must skip work due to extreme temperatures. This reduction in damages is based on the United States Government’s (USG) official estimate of the benefits from each ton of carbon dioxide that is mitigated or not emitted. The USG set the social cost of carbon (SCC) at $225 in benefits created by reducing premature mortality, crop losses, sea-level rise, and other damaging impacts. Greenstone co-led the process to set the original SCC during his time as the Chief Economist for President Obama’s Council of Economic Advisors. The SCC has subsequently become a major part of public policy in the United States and Canada and was recently updated by the Biden Administration, based on new research including work by Greenstone. As the critical second step in the Climate Vault methodology, it will leverage these emission allowances to achieve an equivalent or greater removal of historical emissions already in the atmosphere by offering grants through an annual RFP for Innovative Carbon Dioxide Removal Projects. Climate Vault is currently evaluating proposals received during its latest RFP round . This round saw a more than 500 percent increase in applications, validating that Climate Vault and its supporters are helping to stimulate innovation in this critical area. Contact Climate Vault online to learn more about its first-of-its-kind methodology and get started on a credible carbon reduction strategy. ### About Climate Vault Founded at the University of Chicago, Climate Vault provides the comprehensive solution for truly verifiable and immediate carbon measurement, reductions and removals. Its integrated reduction and removal program leverages government-regulated compliance carbon markets to generate the environmental impact that today’s employees, stakeholders and customers care about and expect from organizations. By providing the most verifiable and immediate carbon reduction solution on the market, at scale, Climate Vault is the all-inclusive alternative to traditional voluntary carbon market programs. Learn more at www.climatevault.org . text:

author: Viviana Monrroy
title: Apagón masivo en Buenos Aires: más de 620.000 usuarios afectados. (18:50)
text:
Un apagón ha afectado a la capital de Argentina, Buenos Aires, dejando sin luz a más de 620.000 usuarios, incluidos la Casa Rosada y el Metro que ha visto afectado su servicio.
El incidente se produce en una jornada de intenso calor, con temperaturas que superan los 40 grados centígrados.
La empresa distribuidora del servicio informó que la falla se debió a una línea de alta tensión y que se espera restablecer el suministro eléctrico en torno a las 16.00 horas (hora local).

author: Ysolt Usigan
title: エンジェルナンバー「000」に隠されたパワフルな意味とは? (Harper's BAZAAR)
text:
By now, you know the universe can sometimes send messages to you. Angels may use numbers in this process to let you know they are watching over you, ready to guide you on your journey towards
spiritual enlightenment and personal growth.
You're probably familiar with common
angel numbers, like 1111 or 444, but rarely do people think about the number zero. However, seeing a triple-zero sequence carries a profound spiritual significance. In this article, experts will help us explore the symbolism behind 000, in addition to its transformative power for when you encounter it.
"Through this number, the angels are encouraging you to trust in your intuition, abilities and talents," says
Linda Berry, “angel whisperer,” spiritual coach and owner of the Spiritual Discovery Center in Southern California. "They believe in you and want you to do the same and want to help you achieve harmony between your personal, professional, and spiritual pursuits."
Number 0 meaning in numerology
According to Mystic Michaela, author of
The Angel Numbers Book, podcast host of Know Your Aura with Mystic Michaela!, "Angel number 0 represents unconditional love. It reminds us that the force of love is around you all the time, taking the form of other people, opportunities, and even moments of clarity."
If you see a 0 with another number, Mystic Michaela says it only enhances all the attributes of that other numbers it appears with.
What does angel number 000 mean?
When you see 0 in a series of three, it adds the vibration of infinite potential, says Berry. Now, how you handle that transitional period will only depend on you: How open-minded are you to new opportunities? Are you ready and willing for
self-improvement? "It requires taking practical steps to reach tangible goals; it's not a number based on hoping and wishing things to realty," says Berry. "In a deeper sense, number 0 represents wisdom and knowledge learned from teachings and life experiences to assist in spiritual growth."
And because the number 0 is also about unconditional love, the number “000” represents the unbounded power of the universe and its potential. "This number is the universe number," says Mystic Michaela. "It signifies the all encompassing power around you that appears in infinite abundance."
According to
Alex Getts, an astrologer and tarot reader of nearly 20 years, "It's about the start of a new cycle or journey, similar to how the Fool is the 0 Tarot card of the Major Arcana."
"In numerology, 000 pertains to a connection with the higher power and entering the journey to step closer to enlightenment," Getts also points out. "Seeing them, simply put, indicates a new beginning or new cycle in this process."
If you encounter 000 frequently, your angels are reminding you of your potential. That means, it's time to tap into your energy source to get what you need.
Love and your twin flame
When it comes to relationships of all kinds — romantic and
twin flame — you should trust the angel wisdom because it will guide you towards harmony and balance. "This number carries energies of trust, communication, and compromise, which are essential elements for a successful partnership," Berry explains.
In your love life, 000 should encourage you to be open and honest with your feelings. "This openness allows for deeper, more meaningful connections with partners," Berry says.
If you're single or dating, however, Berry says 000 serves as a reminder to be mindful of your own needs while also being receptive to the possibilities of new love.
Career and finances
The good news is, you will find success and happiness in your work if you see 000 repeatedly. "Angels are always watching over you and are ready to support you in your quest for personal finance and career success," says Berry. "This number indicates that you're on the right track in your career journey and should continue to pursue your goals with faith in spiritual guidance."
And while you're on the correct path, you're also responsible for making things happen for yourself. You may need to explore new opportunities or make important decisions to steer you in the right direction. Angel numbers are not usually passive scenarios. Part of the work is on you!
"It’s essential to be adaptable and open to change," Berry advises. "Identify necessary adjustments in your life and career path, and most importantly, trust your intuition in making transformative decisions."
Health
Mystic Michaela points out that 000 is asking you to level up in all areas of your life, including your health. "It is a nudge to get moving on some goals you may have left to the wayside while life got in the way," she says. Try starting a new workout or pay a visit to a wellness professional or therapist to assist you in answering this call from your angels.
Berry also reminds that "this number encourages you to create a harmonious environment in your personal life, establish a work-life balance, and prioritize self-care and personal well-being." Again, it's that leveling up your life, but you being engaged to steer yourself towards positive change.
"Understanding your own strengths and weaknesses is vital in following this angel number guidance," Berry adds. "It wants you to recognize the value of self-awareness in personal health... Focusing on your physical and mental well-being is important during your journey, and seeing number 000 is a reminder to prioritize health."
What should you do if you keep seeing angel number 000?
Think of it as a "clean slate" — whether it comes to finance, love, career, or any of your relationships for that matter.
"If you keep seeing 000, take the leap of faith you've been considering," says Getts. "Start that new business, go to that new place. It's not necessarily going to be easy, but it will give you the lessons you need to evolve personally and spiritually."
Mystic Michaela says you can start to create the reality you desire by doing the following upon seeing 000:
- Sit down and write a list of intentions.
- Update your vision board.
- Be mindful of how your actions and words back up your goals and dreams.
Following the message of this number will make you equipped to face life’s challenges, Berry says. You'll be unlocking your potential for personal and spiritual development, so get ready!
Ysolt Usigan is a lifestyle writer and editor with 15+ years of experience working in digital media. She has created share-worthy content for publishers
Shape, What To Expect, Cafe Mom, TODAY, CBS News, HuffPo, The Bump, Health, Ask Men, and Best Gifts. A working mom of two, her editorial expertise in parenting, shopping, and home are rooted in her everyday life.
